comments:
The goals of this course are twofold: (1) to take good programmers and turn them
into excellent ones, and (2) to introduce them to a range of modern software engineering
practices, in particular those embodied in advanced functional programming languages.
Overall, students enjoyed this course and felt that they learned a lot over the semester.
They noted that the content is “useful” and “valuable,” noting that they feel they are
better programmers because of this course. Haskell was used for coding for much of the
class, which some found challenging.
According to past students in her section, Professor Weirich is an effective
teacher. However, students wished that she led better homework discussion, as they did
not find the discussions helpful.
Students did not find the course overly difficult; rather, they found the difficulty
level and work load “just right.” They noted that the assignments were challenging. Pair
programming was required in this class; some felt they benefited by working in pairs,
while others wished that they could have worked alone.
